## What is Python

::: {.fragment .fade-up}
Python is a high level multipurpose programming language used in:  
:::
::: {.fragment .fade-up}
- Web Development   
:::
::: {.fragment .fade-up}
- Aritificial Intelligence
:::
::: {.fragment .fade-up}
- Data Analysis  
:::
::: {.fragment .fade-up}
- Robotics and Automation  
:::
::: {.fragment .fade-up}
- Scientific Computing  
:::
![](images/python.png){.absolute bottom=0 right=50}


## Why Python

::: {.fragment .fade-left}
- It is open-source
:::
::: {.fragment .fade-right}
- It is beginner friendly due to its simplicity, readability and flexibility.
:::
::: {.fragment .fade-left}
- It is multi-purpose
:::
::: {.fragment .fade-right}
- Has a large and active community of users.
:::

## What is Anaconda

::: {.fragment .fade-left}
- It’s a free and open-source distribution of the Python and R programming languages.
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-right}
- It’s a platform for Data Scientists and Machine Learning Professionals.
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-left}
- Has a collection of over 1500 pre-built packages and tools.
:::
![](images/anaconda.png){.absolute bottom=0 right=50}


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Installing Anaconda

::: {.fragment .fade-right}
- Anaconda can be installed from the [Anaconda official website ](https://www.anaconda.com/products/distribution)
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-left}
- After installing Anaconda, click on Jupyter Notebooks
:::


## What is Jupyter Notebooks
::: {.fragment .fade-right}
- Jupyter Notebooks is an open-source web appliation
:::
::: {.fragment .fade-left}
- It's used for data analysis, scientific computingg and machine learning.
:::
::: {.fragment .fade-right}
- Supports the Python Programming language
:::
